I am trying to link to the QA page anchors and they are devilishly hard to follow... it seems to be a baseurl+ file name. for example in the Autobuilder

this is the anchor for this example

http://build.fhir.org/ig/Healthedata1/USCoreR4Validator/branches/master/qa.html#_scratch_ig-build-temp-S8KO1X_repo_source_examples_epic-allergyintolerance-eyHIVsZwhzaZhX9XvFesx5A3

I tried to reproduce this with a bit of javascript and it works locally but not for the autobuild since the url changed.

http://build.fhir.org/ig/Healthedata1/USCoreR4Validator/branches/master/qa.html#build.fhir.org_ig_Healthedata1_USCoreR4Validator_branches_source_examples_epic-allergyintolerance-eyHIVsZwhzaZhX9XvFesx5A3

is it easy to change the html headers to just use the file name so the anchor is easier to follow?

e.g.

http://build.fhir.org/ig/Healthedata1/USCoreR4Validator/branches/master/qa.html#epic-allergyintolerance-eyHIVsZwhzaZhX9XvFesx5A3

Not a priority I will just publish on Git hub pages for now.
what I am trying to do is this: https://healthedata1.github.io/USCoreR4Validator/all-examples.html
I think that what you really want to do is show the validation results for the resource in the IG?
wouldn't the best solution be for me to generate [type]-[id]-validation.html ?
I am really interested in validating the example instances based on the current or latest dev, Its already there, I am just trying to make it easier to find. maybe we are saying the same thing.
well, the examples are already validated. I'll generate the html fragment so you can put it somewhere in the guide. qa.html is not part of the guide.
(I don't want you to reference it)
ok. the new IG publisher I just released produces fragments [type]-[id]-validation.xhtml for you to include somewhere in the IG
